messages.title: It’s time to do things differently
messages.content: Like many, I’m fed up with politics as usual, isn’t it time to do things differently? Let me be your strong voice in Charnwood.

messages.title: Why I am backing Sean Kelly-Walsh
messages.content: I am delighted that Sean Kelly-Walsh is again our candidate for the General Election. Sean stood for Labour in 2015 and increased the Labour vote. He is a passionate, energised and dedicated local campaigner. I look forward to working with him. - Kate Knaggs, Local Councillor

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Stop the break-up of the NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We need more doctors and nurses and we must halt further privatisation. It’s not just the quality of care that will suffer but the NHS and social care.
Reverse the cuts that have seen up to 40% funding loss for schools and pupils and deliver the quality education that every child deserves.
Increase the amount of quality, affordable housing for local people, prioritising both those renting and those who want to own.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Get the economy growing with proper jobs and a £10 minimum wage
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We need more real jobs, paying a real wage, not zero hour contracts and explore a real viable and effective zero hour policy.

Increase education funding fairly, including proper early years support, support for vocational education, reinstating grants for 16 and above and closing the gap between young people as second-class citizens.

issues.brexitEurope: Charnwood like the rest of the Country voted to leave the EU. Now we have to get on with it, to get the best deal for the many, not the few. We cannot just give the Tories a blank cheque. We must listen to both 'Leavers' and 'Remainers'.
issues.economy: Get the economy growing with proper jobs and a £10 minimum wage.
issues.education: An Education system for all. Reverse the cuts that have seen up to 40% funding loss for schools and pupils and deliver the quality education that every child deserves.
issues.health: Stop the break-up of the NHS. We need more doctors and nurses and we must halt further privatisation to maintain quality of care.
issues.labourEmployment: Get the economy growing with proper jobs and a £10 minimum wage.

community.content: Affordable housing for local people. Increase the amount of quality, affordable housing for local people, prioritising both those renting and those who want to own.

leaflet.personalStatement: I’ve lived in Leicestershire my entire working life and have a proven track record of standing up for local people.

politicalExperience.achievements: Increased the Labour vote in the area.

endorsements.endorsement: I am delighted that Sean Kelly-Walsh is again our candidate for the General Election. He is a passionate, energised and dedicated local campaigner.

images.caption: Sean Kelly-Walsh working for you in Charnwood.

examples: ...the cuts that have seen up to 40% funding loss for schools and pupils...
Like many, I’m fed up with politics as usual, isn’t it time to do things differently?
Let me be your strong voice in Charnwood.
We need more doctors and nurses and we must halt further privatisation.
Increase the amount of quality, affordable housing for local people.
Increase the amount of quality, affordable housing for local people.
I’ve lived in Leicestershire my entire working life and have a proven track record of standing up for local people.
Stop the break-up of the NHS.
Reverse the cuts that have seen up to 40% funding loss for schools and pupils.
Get the economy growing with proper jobs and a £10 minimum wage.

I am delighted that Sean Kelly-Walsh is again our candidate for the General Election. Sean stood for Labour in 2015 and increased the Labour vote. He is a passionate, energised and dedicated local campaigner. - Kate Knaggs, Local Councillor
We cannot just give the Tories a blank cheque.
Vote for me and I promise that I will fight for all in Charnwood.
I am angry at the way politics at national level has become a shouting match, with slogans and lies at every turn.
We need more real jobs, paying a real wage, not zero hour contracts...
